intro: Alectra dolichocalyx, commonly known as the long-calyx alectra, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Alectra dolichocalyx is typically found in open, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
